channel.title: Pvp - random drops 317
channel.description: [size=12pt]Me question.[/size] how can I do if someone dies random items that he drops? if you could help me note here that would be excellent: :D My server base is Massacredworld/Demise Pking, My servers name is salusscape..

item.title: Pvp - random drops 317
item.dc:creator: @King_Lingerz King Lingerz
item.description:
@King_Lingerz wrote:

[quote=“deathschaos9, post:13, topic:312733”]I wrote this one… Its works a little bit better.

public void RandomPvP() { int RandomPvP = misc.random(7); if (RandomPvP == 0) ItemHandler.addItem(4151, absX, absY, 1, KillerId, false); else if(RandomPvP == 1) ItemHandler.addItem(8002, absX, absY, 1, KillerId, false); else if(RandomPvP == 2) ItemHandler.addItem(995, absX, absY, 100000, KillerId, false); else if(RandomPvP == 3) ItemHandler.addItem(4153, absX, absY, 1, KillerId, false); else if(RandomPvP == 4) ItemHandler.addItem(8003, absX, absY, 1, KillerId, false); else if(RandomPvP == 5) ItemHandler.addItem(8004, absX, absY, 1, KillerId, false); else if(RandomPvP == 6) ItemHandler.addItem(8005, absX, absY, 1, KillerId, false); else if(RandomPvP == 7) ItemHandler.addItem(8009, absX, absY, 1, KillerId, false); }

Add that as a void anywhere in client.java

Find your kill message and add RandomPvP();

You can add as many random drops as you want. I only did seven.[/quote]

I don’t think you could’ve handled that any worse to be honest.

[quote=“hellwsfull, post:14, topic:312733”]that is better but this is mine:P

add under this :

public class client extends Player implements Runnable {

this

[code=java] public static int Pkdrops[] = {8002,13642,13007,13008,13643,13648,13009,13010,13650,13649,13011,13012,13644,13645,13013,13014,13646,13647,1700,7778,12700,391,391,391,391,391,391,391,391,391,391,391,391,391,391,391,391,391,391,391,391,391,391,391,391,391,391,391,391,391,391,391,391,391,391,391,391,391,391,391,391,391,391,391,391,391,391,391,391,391,391,391,391,391,391,391,391,391,391,391,391,391,391,391,391,391,391,391,391,391,391,391,391,391,391,391,391,391,391,391,391,391,391,391,391,391,391,391,391,391,391,391,391,391,391,391,391,391,391,391,391,391,391,391,391,139,139,139,139,139,139,139,139,3024,3024,3024,3024,3024,3024,3024,3024,3024,3024,3024,3024,6685,6685,6685,6685,6685,6685,7668,7671,7809,7808,7807,7806,7805,7774,7775,7776,7774,7775,7776,7774,7775,7776,7774,7775,7776,7774,7775,7776,7774,7775,7776,7774,7775,7776,7774,7775,7776,7774,7775,7776,7774,7775,7776,7774,7775,7776,};

    public static int randomPkdrops()
    {
        return Pkdrops[(int)(Math.random()*Pkdrops.length)];
    }[/code]

then under this :

[code=java]

add this :

			ItemHandler.addItem(randomPkdrops(), absX, absY, 1, KillerId, false);[/code]			ItemHandler.addItem(526, absX, absY, 1, KillerId, false);

That’s the way to do it.

Read full topic

item.title: Pvp - random drops 317
item.dc:creator: @deathschaos9 DeathsChaos9
item.description:
@deathschaos9 wrote:

I wrote this one… Its works a little bit better.

public void RandomPvP() { int RandomPvP = misc.random(7); if (RandomPvP == 0) ItemHandler.addItem(4151, absX, absY, 1, KillerId, false); else if(RandomPvP == 1) ItemHandler.addItem(8002, absX, absY, 1, KillerId, false); else if(RandomPvP == 2) ItemHandler.addItem(995, absX, absY, 100000, KillerId, false); else if(RandomPvP == 3) ItemHandler.addItem(4153, absX, absY, 1, KillerId, false); else if(RandomPvP == 4) ItemHandler.addItem(8003, absX, absY, 1, KillerId, false); else if(RandomPvP == 5) ItemHandler.addItem(8004, absX, absY, 1, KillerId, false); else if(RandomPvP == 6) ItemHandler.addItem(8005, absX, absY, 1, KillerId, false); else if(RandomPvP == 7) ItemHandler.addItem(8009, absX, absY, 1, KillerId, false); }

Add that as a void anywhere in client.java

Find your kill message and add RandomPvP();

You can add as many random drops as you want. I only did seven.

Read full topic

item.description:
@jamessemple wrote:

well if everyone already drops bones this should be easy.
search for dropItem("526, 1");
—note— depending on your source, you may have to add an AbsX, AbsY-1 thing under it to make it drop directly on the tile that the player was standing on death.
